element.name: Kusarigama
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Kusarigama are martial melee weapons consisting of a sickle attached to a heavy counterweight by a metal chain. They deal 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, count as monk weapons, and have the Versatile (1d6) property. They also have the Special: Counterweight property.

element.name: Special (Kusarigama)
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Special: Counterweight. While wielding a kusarigama with two hands, you can use a bonus action to attack with its counterweight. This attack has a reach of 10 feet and deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage on a hit. You don’t add your ability modifier to the damage of this attack, unless that modifier is negative.

description.p: You gain proficiency with this weapon if you don’t already have it, and it is a monk weapon for you.

element.name: Nunchaku
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Nunchaku are martial melee weapons composed of two hard batons connected to one another by a short chain or tether. They deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage on a hit, count as monk weapons, and have the Finesse, Versatile (1d8), and Special: Flourish properties.

element.name: Special (Nunchaku)
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Special: Flourish. When you are wielding the nunchaku in two hands and take the Attack action on your turn, you can attempt to flourish with the weapon immediately before you make your first attack. To flourish, make a DC 13 Dexterity check, adding your proficiency bonus if you are proficient with nunchaku. On a success, you gain a +2 bonus to the first attack roll you make this turn. On a failure, you deal bludgeoning damage to yourself equal to your proficiency bonus and gain no bonus from your flourishes this turn.

element.name: Tessen
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Tessen are martial melee weapons consisting of folding fans reinforced with wood or metal. The edges contain razor-sharp blades, but they can also be used as bludgeoning weapons when closed. They deal 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, count as monk weapons, and have the Adaptable (bludgeoning), Finesse, and Light properties. They also have the Special: Fan Shield property.

element.name: Special (Tessen)
element.source: Ryoko's Guide to the Yokai Realms

description.p: Special: Fan ShieldWhen you are hit by an attack made with a projectile that weighs less than 2 pounds, such as a thrown dagger, dart, arrow, or bullet, while holding this weapon, you can use your reaction to open the tessen and attempt to deflect the projectile. You gain a +2 bonus to AC against the triggering attack, potentially causing it to miss.
